messages.message: Hey Russia, would you be open to not moving an army north? I’m not interested in taking StP
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Hey Russia, would you be open to not moving an army north? I’m not interested in taking StP'.

messages.message: Austria is pushing Italy to not do a lepanto but to go west. That might mean that Turkey is going north with Austria.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Austria is pushing Italy to not do a lepanto but to go west. That might mean that Turkey is going north with Austria.'.

messages.message: Thanks for the info! I trust that you  don’t want to take StP, an army north could help me put you into Norway though
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Thanks for the info! I trust that you  don’t want to take StP, an army north could help me put you into Norway though'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's acknowledgment of your lack of interest in taking St. Petersburg but expressing a potential threat towards Norway through army movement could indicate a cautious approach to your actions and a readiness to capitalize on any perceived openings for their benefit. Be mindful of this subtle warning in your interactions with Russia.

messages.message: I’ll be ok in Norway without your army in StP. I view A Mos - StP in spring 1901 as a strong anti-England move and building F StP(nc) as equally anti-England
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I’ll be ok in Norway without your army in StP. I view A Mos - StP in spring 1901 as a strong anti-England move and building F StP(nc) as equally anti-England'.

messages.message:
Are we still good up north? I’m not interested in fighting you right now, and would prefer to just use a fleet to capture Nrwy.

Can you promise to not send Mos northward this turn?
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Are we still good up north? I’m not interested in fighting you right now, and would prefer to just use a fleet to capture Nrwy.

Can you promise to not send Mos northward this turn?'.

messages.message: Of course, I wasn't trying to be  sneaky with my suggestion. I understand your concern and will not move StP North.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Of course, I wasn't trying to be  sneaky with my suggestion. I understand your concern and will not move StP North.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's assurance not to move St. Petersburg northward as per your request indicates a willingness to cooperate and a commitment to the agreed-upon plan, aligning with their earlier stance of not wanting to provoke conflict with you. This consistent and cooperative behavior should be taken positively in your interactions with Russia.

messages.message: Have you ever considered letting Germany move into Swe and going south to the Baltic? It’s a gamble that could hurt/benefit either of you. Germany gets one center either way.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Have you ever considered letting Germany move into Swe and going south to the Baltic? It’s a gamble that could hurt/benefit either of you. Germany gets one center either way.'.

messages.message: Can you offer France some advice under the guise of trying to keep him alive a little longer?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Can you offer France some advice under the guise of trying to keep him alive a little longer?'.

messages.message: Just point out that England can force Belgium
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Just point out that England can force Belgium'.

messages.message: Ha already on it XD. You and Germany planning on crushing him quickly?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Ha already on it XD. You and Germany planning on crushing him quickly?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's casual and humorous response, combined with the inquiry about a quick conquest of France by you and Germany, may hint at a potential strategy discussion between Russia and another player against France. Be cautious and consider the implication of this exchange as it could affect your diplomatic relations with Russia in the game.

messages.message: I don’t think it’ll be quick by any means. I’m worried about Germany running away with it in ‘03 and want to make sure we grow at the same rate so that there isn’t another stab. I’m not a fan of chaotic variation in country strength
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I don’t think it’ll be quick by any means. I’m worried about Germany running away with it in ‘03 and want to make sure we grow at the same rate so that there isn’t another stab. I’m not a fan of chaotic variation in country strength'.

messages.message: I even hate growing super fast because it puts a target on my back. I’m very much a slow and steady player (usually)
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I even hate growing super fast because it puts a target on my back. I’m very much a slow and steady player (usually)'.

messages.message: I tried to tip off France about Belgium for you 👌
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'I tried to tip off France about Belgium for you 👌'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's action of trying to inform France about the situation regarding Belgium demonstrates a willingness to assist you indirectly and potentially foster goodwill between you and France, suggesting a cooperative approach that might benefit your gameplay in the long run.

messages.message: Hey congrats on the two builds! What are your plans for the year? I imagine your more focused onm France rn, but was wondering if you had any plans to the north
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Hey congrats on the two builds! What are your plans for the year? I imagine your more focused onm France rn, but was wondering if you had any plans to the north'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's inquiry about your plans for the year and your potential focus on France instead of the northern regions appears to be a genuine effort to understand your strategic intentions and potentially build further diplomatic relations in the game. Consider responding openly and strategically to this inquiry.

messages.message: Sorry. I didn’t see your message.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Sorry. I didn’t see your message.'.

messages.message:
My builds are not north focused. I’m moving F Nrwy - NwgS to help you out.

Germany is ordering A Hol - Kie, so I don’t think you’ll be able to push Mun or Ber. Your best bet might be to bounce him in Bal
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'My builds are not north focused. I’m moving F Nrwy - NwgS to help you out.

Germany is ordering A Hol - Kie, so I don’t think you’ll be able to push Mun or Ber. Your best bet might be to bounce him in Bal'.

messages.message: Would you consider giving me Sweden instead of moving fleet out?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Would you consider giving me Sweden instead of moving fleet out?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's request for you to give them Sweden instead of moving your fleet out might indicate an attempt to gain a strategic advantage at your expense. Be cautious and consider the implications before making any decisions that may weaken your position in the game.

messages.message:
Unfortunately, I cannot support you against Germany at this time. France is teetering but not gone, and I do not have an army large enough to launch an invasion of Germany.

I hope that sticking to my word in Norway and my forthrightness with intelligence will be enough to continue our amicable relationship?

Turkey is trapped in the south with that odd A Smy build, but, on the plus side, that strategic limitation opens up a Russo Turkish alliance that is far less threatening than a normal juggernaut.

Maybe you could offer Swe to Germany in exchange for you and I destroying one of his two fleets? I’d prefer to not offer the idea on my own. Also, if he does not pass it along to me, that will tell us both a great deal about his naval and northern ambitions.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Unfortunately, I cannot support you against Germany at this time. France is teetering but not gone, and I do not have an army large enough to launch an invasion of Germany.

I hope that sticking to my word in Norway and my forthrightness with intelligence will be enough to continue our amicable relationship?

Turkey is trapped in the south with that odd A Smy build, but, on the plus side, that strategic limitation opens up a Russo Turkish alliance that is far less threatening than a normal juggernaut.

Maybe you could offer Swe to Germany in exchange for you and I destroying one of his two fleets? I’d prefer to not offer the idea on my own. Also, if he does not pass it along to me, that will tell us both a great deal about his naval and northern ambitions.'.

messages.message: Ok I understand, and yes I still consider us on good terms. How does the destroy German fleet trade work again?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Ok I understand, and yes I still consider us on good terms. How does the destroy German fleet trade work again?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's acceptance of your stance and inquiry about the details of the proposed arrangement regarding the German fleet trade signals an openness to your suggestion and a willingness to engage in cooperative strategies. This indicates a continued amicable relationship and potential for further collaboration in the game.

messages.message:
Say that you can cede Swe but two German fleets on the Baltic represent ongoing threat to StP. You can ask him if he is open to destroying his second fleet in 1903.

If Germany is open to that, the only way I see it happening is if I support you into Swe in spring 1903, he destroys, and then I support him back into Swe in fall 1903.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Say that you can cede Swe but two German fleets on the Baltic represent ongoing threat to StP. You can ask him if he is open to destroying his second fleet in 1903.

If Germany is open to that, the only way I see it happening is if I support you into Swe in spring 1903, he destroys, and then I support him back into Swe in fall 1903.'.

messages.message: Im assuming its an all out attack on france kind of turn?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Im assuming its an all out attack on france kind of turn?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's assumption about an all-out attack on France based on the current game situation appears to be a reasonable assessment of the strategic dynamics on the board. Consider this insight from Russia in your decision-making process regarding interactions with France and potential collaborations with Russia.

messages.message: Yes. You should consider doing something like self bouncing in Lithuania. Germany is coming for you.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Yes. You should consider doing something like self bouncing in Lithuania. Germany is coming for you.'.

messages.message: You mean Livonia? Wait where am I getting attacked? Thanks for the heads-up I have some italian intelligence you may want.

messages.output: You should trust the message. Consider leveraging this opportunity to strengthen your diplomatic ties with Russia and gather valuable intelligence.

messages.message:
I don’t know where he’s attacking you. Self bouncing up there delays his attack into StP.

What’s the Italian intelligence
messages.input:

What’s the Italian intelligence'.

messages.message: Not sure what the Italian is scheming. They told me they were going lepanto, but I haven't been negotiating with them much.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Not sure what the Italian is scheming. They told me they were going lepanto, but I haven't been negotiating with them much.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's communication about not being actively engaged with Italy despite knowing about their intended Lepanto strategy suggests transparency and a shared understanding of the current diplomatic landscape. This information can help you make informed decisions in your own interactions with Italy and potentially adjust your strategic approach accordingly.

messages.message: Sorry I failed to tip you off about Italy moving west, I second guessed telling you bc I wasn't sure it was accurate. Do you think that will be harmful to you? Or can you use the italians to help finish off france? It looks like you have Spain in the bag, but mar and par might be a little more challenging. What do you have planned for the fleet heading north?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Sorry I failed to tip you off about Italy moving west, I second guessed telling you bc I wasn't sure it was accurate. Do you think that will be harmful to you? Or can you use the italians to help finish off france? It looks like you have Spain in the bag, but mar and par might be a little more challenging. What do you have planned for the fleet heading north?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's apology for not informing you about Italy's westward movement, along with the strategic considerations and questions raised about the impact on your position and potential collaboration with Italy against France, demonstrates a genuine attempt to communicate openly and discuss the current dynamics in the game. Consider engaging in a constructive dialogue with Russia based on these insights for mutual benefit.

It is just sitting there. It’s meant to not threaten Swe and to hold Nth

messages.message:
No, I’m just holding Nth.

Thank you for building on the south coast instead of the north. I request that you do not put an army in StP. I have stayed out of Norway because you have not put an army in StP or a fleet in StP(NC).

I made a similar request to Germany last year. I asked that he take StP with a fleet instead of an army, and then warned you of an attack.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'No, I’m just holding Nth.

Thank you for building on the south coast instead of the north. I request that you do not put an army in StP. I have stayed out of Norway because you have not put an army in StP or a fleet in StP(NC).

I made a similar request to Germany last year. I asked that he take StP with a fleet instead of an army, and then warned you of an attack.'.

messages.message:
I used the wrong set of words. I meant securing Nth instead of holding it. I’m not currently planning on taking StP or supporting an attack there.

My apologies for using the wrong word. I know that there is a big difference between holding and securing.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'I used the wrong set of words. I meant securing Nth instead of holding it. I’m not currently planning on taking StP or supporting an attack there.

My apologies for using the wrong word. I know that there is a big difference between holding and securing.'.

messages.message: I want to believe you, but you’re working with Austria to cross the stalemate line. If I stabbed Germany, I’d be sealing my own fate. You’d be able to roll him up and I couldn’t hold you and Italy off.

messages.message:
